questions.question: Making a call on a landline telephone is a type of network communication.
questions.explanation: Traditional telephone systems are indeed a form of network communication, establishing dedicated circuits for voice transmission.

questions.question: A gateway must be configured for communication between a host and other hosts.
questions.explanation: A gateway is only required when communicating with devices on different networks. Hosts on the same network can communicate directly.

questions.question: When the host accesses web service of the server, the value of the 'Protocol' field at the network layer is 6.
questions.explanation: The Protocol field value 6 indicates TCP, which is used for web services (HTTP/HTTPS).

questions.chapter_name: Network Layer Protocols and IP Addressing
questions.question: When forwarding a data packet, a router needs to change the destination IP address of the packet.
questions.explanation: Routers change the Layer 2 (MAC) address, not the Layer 3 (IP) destination address (except in NAT scenarios).

questions.question: A router in the backbone area has complete LSDBs of routers in other areas.
questions.explanation: Backbone area routers have summarized route information, not complete LSDBs from other areas.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of VLANs in network design?
options: To create broadcast domains within a switch
questions.explanation: VLANs create separate broadcast domains within a single switch, improving network performance and security.

questions.question: What is the default action of an ACL when no rules match?
questions.explanation: ACLs have an implicit deny all at the end, meaning if no rules match, the traffic is denied.

questions.question: IPv6 addresses are 128 bits long.
questions.explanation: IPv6 addresses are 128 bits long, compared to IPv4's 32 bits, providing a much larger address space.
